title: config question  path-specific environment variables
body: issue description or question\r \r hey @artemgovorov! thanks for your previous help with the module aliasing in my lerna repo. i'm still trying to work out more of the kinks.\r \r is there any way to set up the env variables before tests in each file are run? the setup requires:\r   tests in  packages/module-a  need  my_env  to be  test \r   tests in  packages/module-b  need  my_env  to be  testing .\r \r any ideas?\r \r i can't seem to find the function that would be evaluated before each file is run in the docs to do something like:\r \r    js\r beforetestsinfilerun path  {\r   process.env.my_env = path.includes \ packages/module-b\   ? 'testing' : 'test'\r }\r    \r \r   thanks in advance!  \r \r \r     code editor or ide name and version\r \r visual studio code v1.21.1\r \r     os name and version\r \r osx 10.13.4\r

title: not all whitelists are processed
body: create following rules... order of creation is important:\r 1.\r pattern: any\r types: image\r action: filter\r filter url: off\r trim url parameters: trim all\r \r 2.\r pattern scheme: http/https\r pattern host:  \r pattern path: test ,xxxxx   actually just fill something \r types: any type\r action: whitelist\r \r 3.\r pattern scheme: http/https\r pattern host: ksr-ugc.imgix.net\r pattern path:  \r types: image\r action: whitelist\r \r now visit  https://www.kickstarter.com/  https://www.kickstarter.com/ , scroll a bit down and you will see missing images, which were junked by rule 1.\r but, since we have rule 3, those images should have been whitelisted.\r if we disable rule 2, then rule 3 kicks in and images are shown as they should  ok some does not, i believe because of cache or something... but this should be covered in another topic... if firefox is restarted then it works .\r so, i assume that when whitelist rule 2 is processed  doesn't matter if matched or not  then whitelist rule 3 is not processed but should have been.\r \r note: i am using rc 1.7.0beta3\r

title: simplesmtp can corrupt messages, occasionally breaking links and email delivery
body: simplesmtp  is responsible for taking a  mailcomposer  object and sending the email message it represents to the server.  to achieve this, it needs to wrap lines that exceed 76 columns, and to make sure that lines that start with a  .  are escaped  since a  .  on a line of its own indicates end-of-message .\r \r it fails to do the second part correctly, causing the  .  to be swallowed, which  if you're unlucky  can mean several different failure modes, depending on the length and contents of the personal message you wrote:\r \r 1. messages can be truncated and users may receive message fragments. \r 2. messages can lose any number of  .  in the message, including the one in the link back to the grain, making links break.  for instance, i received a link to https://oasis.sandstormio/shared/..., which is missing the . between \ sandstorm\  and \ io\ .  sandstormio is not a valid tld.\r \r options appear to be:\r \r 1. upgrade to node 4 and use  smtp-connection , which is actively maintained.  this involves fixing the  node-capnp  crashes and the usual amount of cautious testing involved when doing major upgrades.\r 2. fork/patch simplesmtp now despite wanting to eventually do 1.\r 3. do nothing.\r \r @jparyani feel free to correct anything above!

title: sni unexpected_hostname_strategy=\ default\  do not work as expected
body: according to a spec unexpected_hostname_strategy=\ default\  should work this way:\r sni present , sni do not match any sni defined backend , so it should fall back to a pool of backends without sni.\r \r in fact gb  reject connection with wring sni hostname\r 2017-09-22 10:00:16  error   server.handle : rejecting client due to not matching sni closing connection\r \r config section:\r \r    \r  servers.test \r bind = \ 10.0.0.1:1000\ \r  client_idle_timeout = \ 1h\  \r client_idle_timeout = \ 0\ \r backend_idle_timeout = \ 0\ \r balance=\ leastconn\ \r \r   servers.test.sni \r  read_timeout = \ 2s\ \r  hostname_matching_strategy = \ exact\ \r  unexpected_hostname_strategy = \ default\ \r \r \r    servers.test.discovery \r   kind = \ static\ \r   static_list =  \r       \ 10.0.0.22:7000 weight=1\ ,\r       \ 10.0.0.23:7000 weight=1\ ,\r       \ 10.0.0.24:7000 weight=1\ ,\r       \ 10.0.0.25:7000 weight=1\ ,\r       \ 10.0.0.28:7000 weight=1\ ,\r       \ 10.0.0.29:7000 weight=1\ ,\r       \ 10.0.0.30:7000 weight=1\ ,\r       \ 10.0.0.80:7000 weight=1\ ,\r       \ 10.0.0.82:7000 weight=1\ ,\r       \ 10.0.0.83:7000 weight=1\ ,\r       \ 10.0.1.20:7000 weight=1 sni=test1.hostname.com\ \r    \r \r   servers.test.healthcheck       optional \r   interval = \ 10s\                \r   timeout = \ 2s\                  \r   fails = 5                      \r   passes = 2                  \r   kind = \ ping\ \r    \r \r sni value for rejected connection test2.hostname.com\r sni value for accepted connection test1.hostname.com\r connections without sni is ok and routed to backends without sni value \r \r gb version: 0.4

title: activate issue with parallel activations - \ file exists\  in symlinked path
body: i'm working in a cluster environment where i am trying to activate a conda environment in multiple parallel processes. after recently upgrading to the latest release  4.1.2 , i've been receiving a \ file exists\  error in some of those processes, similar to the below:      traceback  most recent call last :   file \ /symln_home/anaconda/bin/conda\ , line 6, in <module>     sys.exit main      file \ /users/tomflem/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/conda/cli/main.py\ , line 48, in main     activate.main     file \ /users/tomflem/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/conda/cli/activate.py\ , line 163, in main     conda.install.symlink_conda prefix, root_dir, shell    file \ /users/tomflem/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/conda/install.py\ , line 582, in symlink_conda     symlink_conda_hlp prefix, root_dir, where, symlink_fn    file \ /users/tomflem/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/conda/install.py\ , line 599, in symlink_conda_hlp     symlink_fn root_file, prefix_file  oserror:  errno 17  file exists      i've been able to repro this issue on a laptop when my path to the root anaconda install contains a symlinked directory  \ symln_home,\  in this example . doesn't seem to be a problem when the path is symlink-free. the below has produced the error consistently for me on os x:      $ echo $path /symln_home/anaconda/bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin          python from multiprocessing import pool import os  call =  'source activate myenv && echo $path' for i in range 30   pool = pool 4  pool.map os.system, call  pool.close        is this a bug, or are there any workarounds for this particular use case? in my cluster environment, my home directory  where i've installed anaconda  is symlinked, which i would assume is a fairly common setup in shared computing  i don't admin it, so unfortunately i can't change that aspect .

title: feature  processing  k means clustering algorithm
body: original commit: https://github.com/qgis/qgis/commit/34b9d39b27f8469d03f161eb9eff2ee5aeaa6519 by nyalldawson  adds a native k-means clustering algorithm.  based on a port of postgis' st_clusterkmeans function, this new algorithm adds a new cluster id field to a set of input features identify the feature's cluster based on the k-means clustering approach. if non-point geometries are used as input, the clustering is based off the centroid of the input geometries.

title: keybase encryption in provider is causing a panic
body: terraform version\r    \r 2018/03/08 09:47:52  info  terraform version: 0.11.3  3802b14260603f90c7a1faf55994dcc8933e2069\r 2018/03/08 09:47:52  info  go runtime version: go1.9.1\r    \r \r     terraform configuration files\r \r regular pgp keys work:\r \r    hcl\r resource \ mysql_user_password\  \ jstump\  {\r   user = \ ${mysql_user.jstump.user}\ \r   pgp_key = <<eod\r ...base64 encoded pgp key...\r eod\r }\r    \r \r  keybase:username  causes a panic:\r \r    \r resource \ mysql_user_password\  \ jstump\  {\r   user = \ ${mysql_user.jstump.user}\ \r   pgp_key = \ keybase:plathrop\ \r }\r    \r \r     crash output\r \r https://gist.github.com/joestump/fa93e40d35dfdf8e4a6e26685719b2fa\r \r     expected behavior\r \r it should pull the keybase pgp key and encrypt. i've been going off of the code in   aws_iam_access_key   https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-aws/blob/master/aws/resource_aws_iam_access_key.go l81-l98  to create a   mysql_user_password   https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-mysql/pull/30  resource.\r \r     actual behavior\r \r it panics when i attempt to pull from keybase. it works fine when a base64 encoded pgp key is passed instead.\r \r     steps to reproduce\r \r   check out that pr.\r   try using keybase  keybase:username  and you'll get a panic.\r   use a regular base64 encoded pgp key and it'll work.\r \r     references\r \r related to pr https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-mysql/pull/30

title: add guest user reservations feature  soft appointments
body: soft appointments\r \r many users just  don't want  to get registered to a website for making a reservation, at least for the first time.\r \r this feature would allow those to make a reservation and confirm it through an email link  or other valid channel .\r \r     unconfirmed appointments should be cleared-up to free space  schedule vacancies  after certain time window.\r     the feature should be available for businesses willing to accept this type of reservations.

title: debugger  number of variables are wrong when variables with same name are declared in each block of try statement
body: issue:  \r \r when there are multiple variables declared inside a try-catch-finally block with the same name on debug it list down five variables in that name when there is only 3 variables declared. this is only happening for try-catch block. \r \r   sample code  \r    js\r import ballerina.lang.errors;\r \r function main  string   args  {\r     string   data = null;\r     int   i1 =  1, 2, 3 ;\r     try {\r         int i = 34;\r     } catch  errors:nullreferenceerror nul {\r         int i = 34;\r     }\r     catch  errors:error err {\r             int i = 45;\r     }\r     finally{\r             int i = 56;\r     }\r }\r    \r \r when debug variable listing shows 5 variables with the name   \ i\
